# Error de hidrataci√≥n por anidamiento HTML (2025-12-27 13:45Z)

_**Agent (model claude-4.5-opus-high-thinking, mode Agent)**_

<think><details><summary>Thought Process</summary>
The user is showing me a React hydration error. The error message says:

"In HTML, <div> cannot be a child of <tr>. This will cause a hydration error."

This is a common React/Next.js hydration error that occurs when the HTML structure is invalid - specifically when a `<div>` element is placed inside a `<tr>` (table row) element. In valid HTML, only `<td>` or `<th>` elements can be direct children of `<tr>`.

Looking at the code snippet in the error:
```
<thead data-slot="table-header" className={"[&_tr]:b..."}>
    <TableRow>
        <tr
            data-slot="table-row"
            className="hover:bg-muted/50 data-[state=selected]:bg-muted border-b transition-colors"
```

It seems like there's a `TableRow` component that's rendering a `<tr>`, and there might be a `<div>` somewhere inside it.

Let me search for the table components in the spisa-new frontend to find where this issue is occurring.</details></think>

---

<think><details><summary>Thought Process</summary>
The TooltipProvider is `TooltipPrimitive.Provider` from Radix UI. The Radix Provider typically is a React context provider and doesn't render a DOM element directly - but it might have some DOM output.

Actually, looking at the code more carefully:

```jsx
<TableRow>
  <TableHead>C√≥digo</TableHead>
  ...
  <TooltipProvider>
    <Tooltip>
      <TooltipTrigger asChild>
        <TableHead className="text-right cursor-help">Precio Unit.</TableHead>
      </TooltipTrigger>
      ...
    </Tooltip>
    ...
  </TooltipProvider>
</TableRow>
```

The issue is that TooltipProvider might render a wrapper element (like a div) to provide context. If it renders a `<div>`, then you have `<tr>` > `<div>` which is invalid HTML.

The solution is to move the `<TooltipProvider>` outside the table row, or even wrap the entire table with it. Let me fix this.</details></think>

---

Confirmado. El problema es que `<TooltipProvider>` est√° dentro del `<TableRow>`, y aunque `TooltipPrimitive.Provider` de Radix puede generar un elemento DOM que invalida la estructura `<tr>` ‚Üí solo puede contener `<th>`/`<td>`.

La soluci√≥n es mover el `TooltipProvider` fuera del `TableRow`:

<think><details><summary>Thought Process</summary>
The console messages show no errors! Only LOG and INFO messages related to Fast Refresh and component state. The hydration error about `<div> cannot be a child of <tr>` is no longer appearing. The fix worked.

Let me also take a screenshot to visually confirm the page is working correctly:</details></think>

---

¬°Perfecto! La consola ya no muestra el error de hidrataci√≥n. Solo hay mensajes de LOG e INFO normales del desarrollo. El problema est√° solucionado.

El problema era que el `<TooltipProvider>` estaba directamente dentro del `<TableRow>` (que renderiza un `<tr>`), y en HTML v√°lido, un `<tr>` solo puede contener elementos `<th>` o `<td>`, no `<div>` u otros elementos.

La soluci√≥n fue mover el `<TooltipProvider>` para que envuelva toda la `<Table>` en lugar de estar dentro del `<TableRow>`. Esto permite que los tooltips funcionen correctamente sin violar las reglas de anidamiento de HTML.

---

_**User (2025-12-26 23:39Z)**_

el issue aparece cunado hacemos hover en un header para ver la explicacion

---

_**Agent (model claude-4.5-opus-high-thinking, mode Agent)**_

<think><details><summary>Thought Process</summary>
The user is saying the issue appears when they hover over a header to see the explanation (tooltip). So the hydration error still occurs, but only when hovering on the tooltip triggers.

This makes sense - the issue might be that the `TooltipTrigger` with `asChild` is still causing problems because it wraps around `TableHead` but might inject a div or other element.

Let me think about this more carefully. The Radix Tooltip components work like this:
- `TooltipProvider` - provides context
- `Tooltip` - the root component
- `TooltipTrigger asChild` - renders its child as the trigger (no wrapper)
- `TooltipContent` - the popup content

When using `asChild`, the trigger should not add any wrapper element. However, the `TooltipContent` gets rendered to the DOM when the tooltip is shown, and this might be causing issues.

Actually, looking at the error more carefully - it's showing `<TableRow>` with a `<tr>` inside it. This suggests there might be ANOTHER issue where we have nested table rows.

Wait, looking at the error snippet again:
```
<thead data-slot="table-header" className={"[&_tr]:b..."}>
    <TableRow>
        <tr
            data-slot="table-row"
            className="hover:bg-muted/50 data-[state=selected]:bg-muted border-b transition-colors"
```

This shows `<TableRow>` containing a `<tr>`. But `TableRow` already renders a `<tr>`, so there shouldn't be a nested `<tr>`.

Unless... the error is about the Tooltip structure. When Radix Tooltip renders, the TooltipContent might be rendered inside the TooltipTrigger in some way during hydration, causing the DOM nesting issue.

Let me check what happens with TooltipTrigger asChild. The issue might be that TooltipTrigger tries to render some wrapper that ends up inside the tr element.


Radix Tooltip uses portals by default to render content outside the DOM tree, but during hydration there could be a mismatch between server and client. The real problem might be that Tooltip components shouldn't be inside table rows at all. I could try a different approach - either use a simple `title` attribute, implement a custom tooltip that doesn't inject DOM elements, or wrap the tooltip trigger around an inner element within TableHead instead of the whole header cell.

Let me test wrapping just the text in a span that acts as the tooltip trigger. This keeps the Tooltip component inside the TableHead (`<th>`) rather than directly in the TableRow (`<tr>`), which should avoid the structural issue. I need to check the current file structure to see if TooltipProvider is already positioned correctly outside the table.</details></think>

---

Entiendo. El error aparece cuando se activa el tooltip al hacer hover. El problema es que los componentes `<Tooltip>` directamente como hijos de `<TableRow>` pueden causar problemas de hidrataci√≥n cuando se muestran.

La soluci√≥n correcta es mover los `<Tooltip>` DENTRO de los `<TableHead>`, no como hermanos de ellos:

---

<tool-use data-tool-type="read" data-tool-name="read_file">
<details><summary>Tool use: **read_file** ‚Ä¢ Read file: D:/dialfa new/spisa-new/frontend/app/dashboard/supplier-orders/[id]/page.tsx</summary>

</details>
</tool-use>

---

<think><details><summary>Thought Process</summary>
I see the problem now. The `<Tooltip>` components are direct children of `<TableRow>`. Even though `TooltipTrigger asChild` uses the child element, the `<Tooltip>` component itself (and possibly `<TooltipContent>`) might be rendering additional elements inside the `<tr>`.

The correct approach is to have the `<Tooltip>` INSIDE the `<TableHead>`, wrapping the text content:

```jsx
<TableHead className="text-right cursor-help">
  <Tooltip>
    <TooltipTrigger asChild>
      <span>Precio Unit.</span>
    </TooltipTrigger>
    <TooltipContent>
      <p className="max-w-xs">Precio unitario del art√≠culo</p>
    </TooltipContent>
  </Tooltip>
</TableHead>
```

This way, the Tooltip structure is inside the `<th>` element, not inside the `<tr>` element.</details></think>

---

La soluci√≥n correcta es mover el `<Tooltip>` DENTRO del `<TableHead>`, no como wrapper del `<TableHead>`:

<think><details><summary>Thought Process</summary>
The console is still clean - no hydration errors. The fix is working correctly now.

The problem was:
1. Originally: `<Tooltip>` components were direct children of `<TableRow>`, which caused a hydration error because Radix Tooltip might inject DOM elements (like divs) inside the `<tr>`.

2. First fix attempt: I moved `<TooltipProvider>` outside the table, but this didn't fix the issue because the `<Tooltip>` components were still wrapping `<TableHead>` elements as direct children of `<TableRow>`.

3. Final fix: I restructured so that:
   - `<TooltipProvider>` wraps the entire `<Table>`
   - Each `<Tooltip>` is now INSIDE its corresponding `<TableHead>`, not wrapping it
   - The `<TooltipTrigger>` contains just the text, not the entire cell

This way, the DOM structure is:
- `<tr>` ‚Üí `<th>` ‚Üí `<button>` (TooltipTrigger) ‚Üí text

Which is valid HTML.</details></think>

---

¬°Perfecto! El error de hidrataci√≥n se ha solucionado completamente. La consola no muestra errores incluso despu√©s de hacer hover sobre los tooltips.

**El problema era:**

El componente `<Tooltip>` de Radix estaba envolviendo directamente a `<TableHead>` como hijo del `<TableRow>`. Aunque us√°bamos `asChild`, el componente `<Tooltip>` en s√≠ puede inyectar elementos DOM adicionales que terminaban dentro del `<tr>`, violando las reglas de HTML.

**La soluci√≥n correcta fue:**

Mover el `<Tooltip>` DENTRO del `<TableHead>`, de modo que la estructura sea:
- `<tr>` ‚Üí `<th>` ‚Üí `<Tooltip>` ‚Üí `<TooltipTrigger>` ‚Üí texto

De esta manera:
1. El `<tr>` solo contiene `<th>` (v√°lido)
2. El `<th>` contiene el tooltip (v√°lido, ya que `<th>` puede contener cualquier contenido de flujo)
